                             <div>
                              <div class="VVbkp">
                               <div class="MyMKp u">
                                <div class="nKWJn u">
                                 <svg aria-labelledby=":lithium-R4bal9mapmn9bqauen9:" class="evwcZ" data-automation="bubbleRatingImage" height="16" viewbox="0 0 128 24" width="88">
                                  <title id=":lithium-R4bal9mapmn9bqauen9:">
                                   5 of 5 bubbles
                                  </title>
                                  <path d="M 12 0C5.388 0 0 5.388 0 12s5.388 12 12 12 12-5.38 12-12c0-6.612-5.38-12-12-12z" transform="">
                                  </path>
                                  <path d="M 12 0C5.388 0 0 5.388 0 12s5.388 12 12 12 12-5.38 12-12c0-6.612-5.38-12-12-12z" transform="translate(26 0)">
                                  </path>
                                  <path d="M 12 0C5.388 0 0 5.388 0 12s5.388 12 12 12 12-5.38 12-12c0-6.612-5.38-12-12-12z" transform="translate(52 0)">
                                  </path>
                                  <path d="M 12 0C5.388 0 0 5.388 0 12s5.388 12 12 12 12-5.38 12-12c0-6.612-5.38-12-12-12z" transform="translate(78 0)">
                                  </path>
                                  <path d="M 12 0C5.388 0 0 5.388 0 12s5.388 12 12 12 12-5.38 12-12c0-6.612-5.38-12-12-12z" transform="translate(104 0)">
                                  </path>
                                 </svg>
                                </div>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                             <div class="biGQs _P fiohW qWPrE ncFvv ezezH">
                              <a class="BMQDV _F Gv wSSLS SwZTJ FGwzt ukgoS" href="/ShowUserReviews-g1102395-d17419545-r1021410860-Full_day_Safari_Yala_National_Park_04_30_am_to_06_00_pm_with_Janaka_safari-Ti.html" tabindex="0" target="_blank">
                               <span class="yCeTE">
                                The best option for Yala Safari by far!
                               </span>
                              </a>
                             </div>
                             <div class="_T FKffI bmUTE">
                              <div class="fIrGe _T bgMZj" style="-webkit-line-clamp:7;line-break:normal;cursor:pointer">
                               <div class="biGQs _P pZUbB AWdfh">
                                <span class="JguWG">
                                 <span class="yCeTE">
                                  We chose Janaka tours based on the great reviews, and it was immediately clear that these were fully justified. We were collected by Su, who chatted us through the options for the safari - we could either join with a group of other jeeps (there are literally hundreds lined up to get in at 6am when the reserve opens), or go off on our own - the latter being much more peaceful and more wild feeling but slightly less likely to see the "big three". He also discussed whether we wanted to focus on particular animals or whether we just wanted to see how it went across the trip.
                                  <br/>
                                  <br/>
                                  We had picked a full day (if you can, do this - it makes a huge difference!!!) so decided we would pick the option not to join a big group of jeeps, but we're there really to see the elephants and leopards so asked to prioritise those. We couldn't have made a better decision!
                                  <br/>
                                  <br/>
                                  Su was the perfect guide. Whilst the other jeeps chased around like crazy fighting in groups for a crowded view, we went our own way. Su had the perfect attitude - he never chased the animals, we waited for signs (in this case warning calls from the deer) and then we parked up in the perfect spot. Engine off, it was completely silent - no other people around - and out in front of us just walks a leopard, sits down on a rock and starts washing itself. Because we had the full day we were able to spend 45 minutes just watching this leopard walk around, roll around on the floor and just behave normally. It was perfect. Eventually another driver spotted it too and the hoards of jeeps arrived like an army, but we'd had the perfect experience.
                                  <br/>
                                  <br/>
                                  The same was true of the elephants later in the day - we got perfect views of elephants with no-one else around.
                                  <br/>
                                  <br/>
                                  Su was also very knowledgeable, talked about the animals and set a great example that other drivers we saw could learn a lot from. The food was nice and we finished having seen so so many animals and everything we wanted to.
                                  <br/>
                                  <br/>
                                  I cant rate Su and Janaka any more highly - if you want a real wildness safari feel, great views of the wildlife in real peace, led by a driver who is very much animals-first - this is the tour to get.
                                 </span>
                                </span>
                               </div>
                              </div>
                              <div class="lszDU">
                               <button class="UikNM _G B- _S _W _T c G_ wSSLS wnNQG LbPqG" type="button">

      <div class="sVVKe Q2">
       <div class="JLKop w">
